item.description:
Categories with dice.
5 letter dice have all the A-Z letters.
2 Dice has 12 categories (6 categories each).
20 coins to win.

The game is played simultaneously.
The first player rolls 6 dice: one category die to his choice and all 5 letter dice.
Now there is one category and 5 letters to choose from.
The first player to call out loud a valid word that matches the category die and one of the letters, wins one coin.
The game continues on this manner until there are no more coins to win. The player that collected the highest number of coins wins the game.

Ever played the classic Trivial Pursuit with help of your smartphone or tablet? Now you can! Shuffle Trivial Pursuit combines the classic gameplay with some new features. Play in 2 teams against the time and when you think about the answer to a question your time is decreasing. When your time is out, the game is over and the other team win! Or play without the app just with the card. Your handcards chose whats your next question and you can even steal won cards from your opponents. [User summary]

Dogfight is a board game for two players. There are two levels. In the first level are WWII fighter planes. The second level is more complicated, modern jets use air-to-air missiles beside gun.

The main characteristic is that the game board is covered with a net of equilateral triangles. The vertices of these triangles are points at which players hold the position and move figurines.

The objective is to shoot down all enemy planes. One figurine can shoot on enemy figurine by moving behind it. The game continues until one player runs out of the plane.

link.value: 1941: Fire in the sky above Belgrade

item.description:
SupersoniÄna trka is a very simple game for 2 to 4 players. Board has 3D elements.

Each player has one plane. All planes circle around the airport. There are several paths that are intertwined. Shorter paths have more obstacles (clouds) that slow down the planes. The winner is the player whose plane first gets to the finish line.

Typical roll and move game. Players are going around the game board. The first player who cross the route, wins the game.
Great graphics feature the intrepid Ahrens-Fox fire pumper truck, a folding board is traversed by 12 cast lead miniature Ahrens-Fox pumpers in 4 different colors.

Board game Dinosaurusi is a simple game for 2 to 4 players. Each player has one figurine. The aim is to get to the finish as soon as possible. Paths which are moving figurines on are mutually intersect. In addition to the path are arranged markers (food) that players collect. Longer paths have more markers. The player whose figurine first reaches the finish receives 6 points, second 4 and third place 2 points. It is also important to collect as many markers. Each marker delivers one point. The winner is the player who at the end of the game has the most points.

Ko to leti is a game for 2 to 4 players. On the board is shown sky where there are many aircraft. Each player has one figurine. The figurine represents a fighter reconnaissance plane. The task is to collect markers. That means that the reconnaissance aircraft photographed and recognized the plane. The game lasts until all of the markers are collected. The winner is the player who has the most.

This is a board game about Swedish politics. It is for you who like to play boardgames with friends and family and is interested in politics and want to learn more and challenge your friends in who know the most.

How to play:
All players choose what politician to play with, and then you move your player with the help of two dices. For advanced players you can use stepping cards to adjust your steps back or forward, depending on on what strategy you have. On each step you can earn - or steal, a percentage (points) depending on the type of card you get. The player with the most percentage in the end of the game will win.

Card categories:

- Quotes
You need to answer what politician who said the quote.

- Media
The media cards will give you points och tell you to give point sto your fellow players depending on what you have done and what the media is reporting.

- Politician parties
Questions about the different political parties.

- Debate
Here you choose your debate strategy against one of the other players, and dependent on the result you will either steal percentage from the other player, or give away. This part is based on rock, paper and scissors.

Who knows the most
On this type of cards you can choose, dependent on the category of the card, if you want to answer it or let one of the other players do so. Dependent on your strategy, and if the answer is correct or not, you and the other player will either get percentage, or you will have to give percentage away.


Swedish
Jakten på Makten är ett brädspel om politik och samhället för dig som gillar sällskapsspel, politik eller bara vill ha ett väldigt unikt svenskt spel där du och dina motspelare garanterat lär er något och får något att diskutera. Alla kan spela spelet, oberoende av politisk inriktning.

Så spelar du:

Ni väljer vilken makthavare ni ska ha som spelpjäs, den turas ni om att förflytta längs spelplanen med hjälp av två tärningar (och med hjälp stegkort för er som är strategiskt lagda och inte gillar tärningar). För varje varv ni går kommer ni närmare mandatperiodens slut. När det sker är det den som har flest procent (poäng) som vinner. Procenten kan du få när du landar på spelplanens olika rutor, nedan står det vilka rutor som finns.

Citat:

Du får ett citat uppläst och ska gissa vilken politiker som har sagt det. Gissar du rätt får du en procent.

Media:

Mediakorten innehåller påståenden som du drabbas av, du kan t.ex. behöva ge bort en procent för att du sagt att Stockholmare är smartare än lantisar eller få en procent för att du höll ett fantastiskt sommartal.

Partikunskap:

Du svarar på en fråga som har med partierna att göra, svarar du rätt får du en procent.


Debatt:

Du möter valfri spelare och den som vinner debatten får procent. Debattera gör ni genom att visa varsitt debattkort samtidigt. Om den ena har ett kort där det står "humor (tar fakta)" och den andra har ett kort där det står "fakta (tar arg)" vinner den förstnämnda. Det är lite som sten, sax, påse.

Vem vet mest:

Precis som i TV-programmet får du välja om du vill svara på frågan i kategorin du hamnar på eller om någon annan spelare ska göra det. Svarar du själv får du procent vid rätt svar och blir av med procent vid fel svar. Väljer du att någon annan ska svara får ni båda procent ifall svaret är korrekt.

Border Reiver Miniature Wargaming Rules.

Rules for fighting out raids and retribution between rival border clans in sixteenth century Britain. Each player raises an army of between 10 and 30 models: each represents one Reiver and ideally players will have mounted and dismounted versions of each.

Models are classified according to armour, weapons, and their ability to fight as border raiders. Dice are rolled to resolve combat and morale tests.

4 scenarios are included as are campaign rules.

Although these rules are intended for wargames set in the sixteenth century, they should provide a workable foundation for raiding games set earlier and later in history; they have worked quite well for me with Highwaymen, for a variety of ‘sword and shield’ skirmishes, and for the medieval border wars between England and Scotland.

name.value: RIBBIT: The Jump, Move, and Block Game

item.description:
A classic maneuver strategy game akin to checkers. RIBBIT is a two player game with one player taking the red pieces and the other the blue pieces. Each player has 5 pieces (wooden meeples) and 3 blockers (wooden disks). A player wins by exiting his pieces (meeples) and scoring points. The player who scores best out of 11 points (6 or more) wins the game.

During a player's turn they get two actions. There are 5 possible actions a player can take. They are:

1. Move a piece (meeple)
2. Enter a piece (enter a Meeple from your Stock)
3. Exit a piece (exit meeple to score points)
4. Place a blocker (disk that blocks meeple into a space)
5. Jump a piece (over an opponents piece when you have two pieces next to one opponent piece).

Components
High impact Plastic board
10 wooden Meeples (5 Blue, 5 Red)
6 wooden discs (3 Blue, 3 Red)
Rules (1 page)
Game Variants and Strategy Tips (1 page)
Ziplock Bag

item.description: Sixteen Stone is an abstract strategy game played on a 5x5 grid. Each player has 8 stones in either red or blue. The objective of the game is to remove all of your opponents stones from the board by either pushing them off of the board or by capturing them. Sixteen Stone was placed into the Public Domain on 12/3/2015 by the Designer.

name.value: Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Rumble at Castle Tentakill
Эпичные схватки боевых магов: Бесчинство в замке Спрутобойни

item.description:
The sleeper hit has awakened! Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Rumble at Castle Tentakill is finally here and it’s loaded with all-new ways to deliver a smoking death to all who oppose you. This stand-alone game is also 100% compatible with the original game, which allows players to turn an already epic game into an EPIC game. Epic Spell Wars continues its epic quest after airing on TableTop on Geek and Sundry! Featuring game design and all-new art from the original creative team of Cory Jones, Rob Heinsoo, and Nick Edwards.

New Addition: Creatures! Delivery cards in this set can also become your pets if you roll well enough. With a familiar by your side for a few rounds, you’ll be unstoppable. But if a big splash of damage is heading your way, why not have your little buddy jump in the way and take that blast instead of you?

New Addition: Blood! Collect Blood as you slay your opponents and tempt fate with powerful magiks and treasures. Use your Blood points to make some spells even more powerful than before.

New Addition: Reactions! A few spells will partially resolve even if you die too soon. Now you can play a full-strength spell without fretting about dying before it resolves. With a Reaction in there, you’ll get your revenge…

New Addition: The Standee matters! That crazy stand-up piece is now a coveted heirloom in the game. If you control it, several of your spells will increase in strength. It can also earn you some extra Blood.

Whether you have played the original or not, this new set will provide everything you need to start blasting your opponents into tiny bits of goo. Experienced players will find new challenges and they’ll marvel at the all-new Treasures and Dead Wizard cards as well. Mix the two sets together for the ultimate carnage-fest!

Epic Spell Wars of the Battle Wizards: Dr. Hannah and Wilhellion Promo Cards

item.description:
TGABA (Trivia Game About Black Americans) can be played by two or more players, or by a group divided into teams. A moderator is needed to ask questions and decide which participant answers correctly and fastest.

One questions is asked for each card. The team answering each question correctly "owns" that card; the team "owning" the greatest number of cards at the end of the game is the winner.

Knight Fight is a dice game for two players lasting around 5 minutes, that sees two brave Knights face off in mortal combat. The objective of the game is to score three hits on your opponent.

The game is played with two sets of polyhedral dice: d4, d6, d8, d10x2, d12 and d20. The d4, d6, and d8 represent weapons, the d10 gauntlets, the d12 a helmet and d20 a shield.

The game is set up by both players rolling their d12. The result is each players' Defence number. The number the opposing player needs to beat to score a hit on them. This Defence can be added to when the player chooses to Defend.

Players secretly choose dice to roll, and roll them simultaneously onto the table. Players can choose to Attack (with a weapon and a gauntlet), Defend (with a weapon or a shield), Jostle/Disarm (with a Gauntlet) or Regather (where a player only feigns to roll dice, allowing them to return dice rolled on previous turns to their hand).

The dice results are compared and players may retrieve only one of their rolled dice, the rest are "placed with their squire".

The game can be played using optional Knight and Items cards that introduce variable player powers and greater tactical depth.

The game is played on an 8x8 board representing a garden.

There are two players – White and Red. Each player has sixteen pieces consisting of:


 A piece of garden Décor
 Three Queens
 A dozen Roses


The garden Décor (a statue and a bench) once set does not move and cannot be captured by either side. In other words, they act as permanent Blocks.

The Queens move and capture just like Chess Queens.

The Roses, once placed, do not move.

The game is played in two phases – “Planting” and “Gathering”

Planting: The players first each set their own piece of Décor on any empty space on the board. This is then followed by their Queens. The players must place their Queens so no Queen can immediately attack an opponent’s Queen. Lastly, all the Roses are arranged around the board, in any remaining empty spaces.

Gathering: Once all the pieces are set, players then can move their Queens around the board, capturing an opponent’s pieces – both Roses and Queens.

Goal - There are two different ways to win:

 Capture all twelve of your opponent’s Roses
 Capture all three of your opponent’s Queens

Survive an undead apocalypse and deliver the cure to eliminate the pandemic. Players work together to save humanity from near certain doom.

Simulating Hordes of Zombies migrating throughout a metropolis, players move through the city attempting to combine elements of a cure to eliminate the Zombie infestation.

Each Player chooses a different Role to play for the game with a variety of different abilities and carrying capacities. With Five Roles to choose from players must develop different strategies every game in order to fight off the multitude of zombie hordes.

The five roles are; Sniper, Hunter, Medic, Mechanic and Scavenger.

Gather Weapons, Equipment, and Vehicles. 
Store Supplies: Food, Ammo, Medicine, and Fuel in Hideouts.

No Dice - No Complicated Rules - Easy and Fun to Play

ATC Rush Hour is a game in which players take role of Air Traffic Controllers on an airport. The main objective of the game is to make sure that all the planes land or take off without any problems. The game will is available to play from 4 to 6 players. Each player controls one airport with its ATC (Air Traffic Controllers) and try to take off and land as many planes as possible.

Each player receives one board at the start of the game. The board represents an airport that is controlled by the player and it is divided into five Zones and seven spaces for Action cards. The Zones are used as an areas to place ATC and Plane cards and the other spaces are destined for corresponding Action cards (Airport, Upgrade, Event and Weather).

The key element of the game is moving the Planes between the Zones and players. The Planes are moved by sending them ATC commands. To send a command to a Plane, a player must pay with ATC points, which is done by removing a number of counters from ATC cards. Moving Planes provides victory points which are needed to win the game.

You are a monkey who run fruit farms. Plant seeds to grow your fruits and pick it for getting new farms. Easy-to-Learn family strategy game with a mancala mechanism plus some randomness.

There are some differences between 1st and 2nd. Changed rules, added four Rain Cards and a Market Sheet.

item.description:
What the Fact (WTF) is an outrageously fun, quick & easy (like your mom) party game. Dice make the game about the players & what you'll post on social media to win.

A player selects a black card and rolls the dice to find out which player the card is about. Each of the other players turn in a gray card that fills in the blank and completes the fact. The person giving the most outrageous card wins the round.

The dice symbol represents whichever name came up on the dice. Where it gets even more interesting: if you roll a "WTF", the card is up for grabs! The symbol then represents YOUR OWN NAME and the first person to post the phrase online gets the point. This could lead to some interesting What The Fact moments!

The Werewolf awake at the midnight, and touches Villager's fingers. Who touched your finger? Very simple and fun party game.

This game is made as Postcard Game.

You control the destiny of five fearless warriors. You will battle your way through three types of terrain: the damp Darkwoods, the rugged mountains, and the open plains. On your quest you will encounter trolls, deadly Knights and face attacks from every side. It is your mission to advance your satyr through the regions of battle, avoiding the death traps and protecting him at all costs. Because if you're satyr dies, your chance of winning the war dies with him.

Players roll dice to move around a track, through different regions of the board, and attack the other player by again rolling dice and comparing to a combat resolution chart to modify the rolls.

Final Attack! is a real-time cooperative tabletop strategy game for 1-5 players. You will pilot the K-Machines, ancient yet technologically advanced fighting mecha that can combine to form Final Kaiser, champion of justice. You will do battle against shapeshifting mechanical monsters called Robeasts, gigantic foot soldiers of the starfaring artificial intelligence FANGER. Your only way to defeat these terrors is to use the Final Attack, an all-powerful weapon that takes the entire game to charge.

Final Attack! is a unique blend of card game, worker placement game, social game, and arcade game. You will play cards, you will move chips around the table, you will solve resource puzzles, you will yell attack names, and you will endure hardship by yourself or with whatever companions fate has provided, all in real time. The game takes between 20 and 30 minutes to play, and there is absolutely nothing else like it.

item.description:
From publisher's website:

As long as there has been language, there has been storytelling. One of our oldest traditions, passed down from generation to generation for thousands of years, it's a great way to teach, to learn, or to just have fun! And it has never needed a screen or batteries.

Now it's your turn to roll your very own story with Story Time Dice! Suitable for all ages and any number of players, these seven big, chunky polyhedral dice come in a variety of fun shapes, and with a quick roll will help you spin a million grand tales. Pit 12 heroes against 10 villains in 6 settings, using 20 tools and 8 vehicles to overcome 6 obstacles and claim 6 prizes! Can you create an adventure in which a lost diver thwarts a robot in a haunted house using music and a time warp to collect a valuable treasure? It's all up to the dice, and your imagination!

This Story Time Dice set includes:
3 six-sided dice with settings, obstacles and prizes
1 eight-sided vehicles die
1 ten-sided villains die
1 twelve-sided heroes die
1 twenty-sided tools die
1 guide to every icon on the dice
4 recommended games to play: Once Upon a Time, One by One, Heroes & Villains (see below), and Rescue Operation

Once Upon a Time and One by One are different styles of storytelling.

Rescue Operation
Have each player roll the hero die and the vehicle or tool dice to determine his/her character and their abilities. When all players have finished, one player rolls the villain, obstacle and setting dice and uses them to create a sticky situation for their character. The other players then must use their characters' abilities and teamwork to create a story in which they rescue their friend. The captured character can make their job more difficult by rolling more obstacles and villains into the story!

Heroes & Villains
One player rolls the hero die to create a character, then rolls the tool die three times and the vehicle die once to create their character's arsenal. The other player does the same, using the villain dice instead of the hero. The villain begins the story by using their character and arsenal to turn the situation against the hero. The hero then continues the story by trying to beat the villain. Players continue taking turns. The game is over when one player can't image how they could possibly win!

item.description:
Hold my hand is a party card game for 4-8 players. Players are children lost in fairy forest, trying to get out without becoming fairies. Children are scared, and unaware that one of them might be a fairy.

The game is played drafting cards. In each turn players look at the cards in their hands, put one card either in front of themselves(1) or in between themselves and player next to them(2 or 3). (look at the picture). These cards are put face down.
Then pass rest of the cards to the left.
Then players decide which card that is in between will they look at...

You have the game and the rules in the files section, so just take a look ;)

Fallen is a card and dice game in which two players battle deep within a dungeon. One player takes on the role of the Hero, exploring the twisting halls and deadly chambers of the labyrinth. Another player takes on the role of the Dungeon Lord, summoning monstrous creatures and wielding dark magic.

The adventure is brought to life through an array of cards and dice. As players explore the dungeon, Store Cards describe the rooms and challenges the Hero will face. When a battle erupts or a trap is sprung, Challenge Dice are rolled to see who is victorious.

The adventure culminates in an epic battle between the Hero and the Dungeon Lord with only one player left standing.

The Kickstarter Edition of the game includes 50 additional story cards plus new heroes (Adren the Knight, Cael Oathbringer the Priest, and Rivern the Huntress) and new dungeon lord characters (Norathra the Forsaken, Spider Queen, and Sythean the Devourer).

Specifically this includes:


 50 Story Cards
 3 Advanced Hero Character Cards
 3 Advanced Dungeon Lord Character Cards
 23 Creature Cards
 27 Hero Skill cards
 4 Basic Equipment cards
 13 Treasure cards
 30 Power cards (Hero)
 30 Power cards (Dungeon Lord)
 8 Omen cards
 42 Final Battle cards
 3 Sythean Creature cards
 6 Sythean Critical cards
 3 Cael Rune cards
 12 Cael Rune tokens
 4 Norathra Blood Vine tokens
 1 Rivern Mark token
 1 Blood token
 2 Adren Shield tokens
 1 Spider Queen Web card
 10 Spider Queen Web tokens

Senet is an ancient Egyptian board game.

Senet and Senet-modern are almost looks same but Senet-modern rule is arranged and renewed more speedy, offensive and strategic.

Players move own 5 pieces due to 2 dice number and be up the goal side.

One difference is that players can make opponent's piece out of board and another is Senet-modern pieces are printed different number's dots 1 to 5. Number is score.
 The winner is the player who get more score when 3 pieces(both own and opponent) are upped.

item.description:
Party game. In the box there is a roll of twine. This should be cut to 4 equal lengths. One end of the twine is tied to a chair leg and the other end is held by the players. So, the players at the starting line will all be holding a length of twine (about 12 feet long) and they must pull it backwards so that the twine doesn't sag in the middle and the line should be about 18 inches off the floor. Each player now has a 'Donkey' put on to their twine, as near to the players' as possible.

On the word "Off", each player has to jog their twine furiously so that their donkey heads towards their chair. The first to touch the chair leg with their donkey's nose, wins.

The game can be modified to allow young children to play.

Aquarium is an underwater city represented on the board by twelve colonies divided into three levels deep. The game action takes place at the end of the XXI century. The match lasts three steps with five rounds in each step. The main goal of each player is to build various elements within the city to score more points.

In his turn a player can move your submarine spending uranium units and after it must intercept a character and do an action. There are five characters in the game: Commander - allows supply the submarine with new crew and also allows the entry of inhabitants in the city. Engineer - builds elements within the colonies. Scientist Alien - provides technology cards. Controller - supplies submarines and the colonies with oxygen. Investor - provides money to players.

In addition, Aquarium has two mini expansions included in the base game: 1 - Special Card characters. 2 - Saboteur, which allows players to hinder the plans of his opponents interrupting the flow of oxygen in certain colonies of the board and causing unexpected penalties!

item.description:
This game includes both OGRE and its sequel G.E.V., tactical ground combat games set in the not-so-distant future. In 2085 A.D., armored warfare continues - faster and deadlier than ever. Hovercraft, tanks and infantry slug it out with tactical nuclear devices. But the most feared weapon of all needs no human guidance. It's a giant cybernetic tank called the OGRE.

The basic OGRE game gives one player a force of infantry and armor, and a command post he must defend. The other player has only one unit - but it's an OGRE. It's an even match. Advanced games allow solitaire or multi-player action, with OGREs on both sides.

In G.E.V., units from Ogre are carried over, with expanded rules for terrain. A larger map and more ambitious game.

Are you troubled by strange noises in the middle of the night? Do you experience feelings of dread in your basement or attic? Have you or your family ever seen a spook, spectre, or ghost? If the answer is "yes", then don't wait another minute. Pick up the phone and call the professionals!

Ghostbusters: The Board Game is an episodic adventure game for one to four players, who are charged with busting ghosts and sealing gates to the Spirit World. In the game, players choose one of the four Ghostbusters character figures — Peter Venkman, Egon Spengler, Winston Zeddemore and Ray Stantz — then select one of the game's pre-written scenarios, beginning a game session that lasts from 30 minutes to two hours, depending on the chosen scenario(s) and degree of difficulty. Each of the Ghostbusters has unique traits and talents that can assist the entire team, with highly co-operative gameplay. As players gain experience from banishing spirits, the Ghostbusters level up, gaining new abilities that help them take on greater challenges. The team can also hop in the Ecto-1, the Ghostbusters' converted ambulance, to help them quickly move through the city.

Ghostbusters: The Board Game comes with more than forty plastic figures, including the four Ghostbusters, Slimer, Stay Puft Marshmallow Man, Indulnas, and numerous Galloping Ghouls, Gruesome Twosomes and Boogaloo. The game board is created with double-sided modular pieces, increasing the game's replayability for scenarios and customization.

item.description:
Did you know that nine U.S. Presidents didn't attend college? Or that six Presidents were born in Ohio, more than any other state? And that one President was stopped for a speeding ticket while riding a horse?

In Presidents Poker, players assemble a hand of President cards with the Presidents that have the most in common, including names, birthplace, college attended, number of children, height, and hair color. Each President card also has a fun fact about that President so that these historical figures really come to life. Chips are included for those who like to bet.
The standard board game of Monopoly but re-themed for the great city of Charlotte, NC.

Let's bring the past and the future to the present with this awesome fighting card and dice game. Come join the action packed, fast paced, imaginary galaxy described as Street Fighter meets pro wrestling! Welcome to the IFC!

This game takes elements of various games and molded its own to create what is now the IFC. It's a simple fight game that has no crazy charts, move cards or other wacky add ons...just simple cards with vibrant characters, dice and your imagination.

Set up a fight card, play the matches, create the drama...it's all about letting your imagination run wild!

item.description: Get ready to flip out with this flip 'n slide game of tic-tac-toe! Slideways is a fast-paced puzzle game of logic and skill that raises the bar on fun as players try to outwit their opponents. Move your bar on the board or flip colors to get four in a row. Is it as easy as it seems?

Game description from the publisher:

Think fast! Spit It Out! is the fun, fast-paced party game in which you have to retrain your brain to give the WRONG answer to easy questions — but sometimes you have to give the RIGHT answers, too, and you have just thirty seconds to spit it out! Rewire your brain to victory in this hilarious game where wrong is right.

The first player to collect three cups wins!

name.value: DC Comics Dice Masters: War of Light

item.description:
Game description from the publisher:

DC Comics Dice Masters: War of Light is a collectible dice-building tabletop game designed by Quarriors! creators Michael Elliott and Eric M. Lang.

In this game, each player fields one of the superhero teams, with each hero — Batman, Wonder Woman, Hal Jordan, Mogo, Superboy Prime, Sinestro and more — being represented by custom-tooled dice; each team must be composed of 15 dice, and a player can "purchase" dice only from his team. Each hero also has one or more character reference cards, which show the special abilities for the characters based on the die rolls. Different versions of these cards are available in booster packs, allowing for more customization of your team. Players use these dice to collect energy, recruit new heroes, and battle head-to-head. In addition, each player brings two basic action cards to the game, which are placed in the center of the table; both players can purchase these cards. A player wins once the opposing player has been reduced to zero life.

DC Comics Dice Masters: War of Light debuts both the Teen Titans and new Lantern Corps never before seen in Dice Masters! With gameplay that supports two players in epic dice battles, DC Comics Dice Masters: War of Light lets players build their own team of heroes or villains!

item.description:
News@11 is a recursive storytelling game in which the players are anchors at a news desk or on assignment in a world going weird. The game is played in three rounds — Morning News, News at Noon and Evening Edition — in which the players take turns making up news stories, using elements from the previous rounds, as well as bringing new items in. They have to think on their feet and adapt their news stories to different newscaster roles.

Each round, the players need to adapt the story elements they are given to the news segment they have been assigned. Being assigned a segment helps players build a starting story and in future rounds causes stories to blend and change in interesting ways.

The three recursive rounds are at the core of the experience. Seeing the same news item start out as a relatively simple Home and Beauty segment, then in Sportsball a bit more odd and unbelievable, and finally as a Political where the hilarious chaos peaks adds to the zany nature of the recursion.

item.description:
A game of skill and chance for two!

FROM THE GAME BOX:

OBJECT OF THE GAME: For the hunter to capture the fox.

PIECES NEEDED TO PLAY : Two different colored pegs and 1 pair of dice. The Fox makes the first move. Both he and the Hunter can only move along the lines. Both Fox and Hunter alternate turns moving only one space at a time. The Hunter tries to force the Fox into a position where the Hunter's next move would be into the same hole the Fox is in. When the Hunter reaches this position he rolls the dice. If he rolls an even number, he has netted the Fox. If he rolls an odd number the Fox may take two moves and thus gets away. The game continues until the Hunter again corners the Fox. At this time the Hunter again rolls the dice. If an even number is rolled the Hunter wins, but if an odd number is rolled the Fox has eluded the Hunter for the second time, and the Fox is the winner.

You and your friends are business moguls and there is a new plot of land in the city that is ripe for building! You want to build the most floors, have the tallest sky scrapers, and screw over your opponents. Each tunr you take your fortune into your own hands by choosing more or less risky bets on what numbers will be rolled and what resources to collect.

Corporate America was built on ruthless tactics and stock photography. The dark humor and art reinforces this point with leadership cards that players strategically utilize to gain ground on their opponents.

My Metropolis is a 3-4 player worker game that features worker placement and resource collection. Inspired by Settlers of Catan and Small World, My Metropolis is a fast paced and cut throat gaming experience with varied strategy and unique artwork.

name.value: Lost Legacy: Second Chronicle – Vorpal Sword & Whitegold Spire
Legado Perdido: La espada Vorpal y El Chapitel de Electro
Lost Legacy: Das Todesschwert & der Weissgoldturm

item.description:
In the distant past, a starship from a faraway world appeared in the sky. Damaged in battle, the craft broke apart and traced lines of fire across the horizon. These falling stars crashed to the surface, and in the ages to come, became enshrined in legends as the Lost Legacy. Discover where the Lost Legacy can be found and win the game!

Lost Legacy: Second Chronicle contains two sets of game cards: Vorpal Sword and Whitegold Spire. Each set can be played independently or mixed together with other sets to create a unique custom set.

As for how to play, Lost Legacy is a game of risk, deduction, and luck for 2–4 players. You start the game with one card in hand from a deck of sixteen cards. On a turn, you do the following:


 Draw: Draw the top card from the deck and add it to your hand.
 Play: Choose one of the two cards in hand to play and place it face up in front of you.
 Effect: Carry out the played card's effect, after which the card is considered as discarded.
 End: Throughout gameplay you're trying to eliminate other players or uncover the location of the "Lost Legacy" card; this card might also be in the "Ruins", a location that holds one card at the start of the game and possibly acquires more cards during play. When someone discovers the Lost Legacy, the game ends, everyone tallies the value of the cards they've played and the card left in hand, and whoever has the highest total wins.
 


By combining different Lost Legacy sets (while keeping only a single Lost Legacy card in play), up to six players can compete at the same time.

name.value: Character Quest: Heroes The Card Game – Game Pack #2: Savage Beasts

item.description:
In CQ:Heroes, up to 4 players take turns collecting heroes and sending them out to gain victory points for your tavern. From the mighty Paladins and Wardens of the King's Guard from Game Pack #1 to the powerful Great Wolves and Berserkers from Game Pack #2, Savage Beasts, each player will try to create a powerful combo of heroes to defeat even the toughest locations.

The heroes from Game Pack #2 - Savage Beasts feature Pet heroes that can be controlled by the Beastmaster skill.

Game Pack #2 - Savage Beasts includes the Adventure Deck: Desert Temple which features all new cards including a new card type: Raid Boss. These encounters are much tougher than normal encounters and are placed in the location area when revealed.
The new objective in Desert Temple is to defeat 3 of these Raid Bosses to open up the Throne Room. This triggers the final battle where all players make last party of heroes to battle each other for the room's treasures.

GAME FEATURES:

Simple and engaging: Although it's simple to learn and play, turns can become quite involved with all of the hero abilities and how you combo them during your turn.

Everyone plays to the end: No one is eliminated during the game and all players count their victory points at the end.

Quick flow of play: Because you draw up your hand at the end of your turn, you are then able to plan your next turn while others are taking theirs.

Accessible: Only 1 deck is needed for up to 4 players. Extra decks can be used separately by each player or shuffled together for everyone to share.

Easy to collect: No mystery packs. Each deck has all the cards you need to play.

Fast: The game sets up in less than a minute and plays in about 10-20 minutes.

HOW TO PLAY:

Starting with the first player, each player performs the following 4 actions in order:

ATTACK: Attack 1 encounter OR skip your attack to add one additional Hero to your Tavern on the next step
TAVERN: Place 1 hero in your Tavern (2 if you skipped your attack)
DRAW: Draw your hand back up to 5 cards
REFRESH: Draw and add 1 new Adventure card to the dungeon hall

link.value: Character Quest: Desert Warrior's Hero Set

Character Quest: Heroes The Card Game – Game Pack #3: Haunted Oak

name.value: Character Quest: Heroes – Goblin Raiders Adventure

item.description:
Goblin Raiders Adventure intro: The nearby farms are being captured and pillaged! Lead by a Goblin Brute that must be defeated. Player's take turns trying to free Wheat Field locations before Goblin Torchers show up and pillage them. Once the fields have been rescued (or burned), players will then be able to try and defeat the Goblin Brute before time runs out!

A full 50 card hero deck. It has a few heroes from Game Pack #1, a few from Game Pack #2 and a couple heroes from a future Game Pack (sneak peak of the Storm Shaman, Half-Giant Warrior, and Templar)

The full 26 card Goblin Raiders Adventure deck is a spin off of the Goblin Keep Adventure but it also includes a few new cards made just for this demo (mostly to help with the new objective of stopping the goblins from raiding nearby farmlands!)

This introductory set does not use the final art from either Game Pack #1 or #2. The cards also reference 'Raid', this simply means a fight or battle.

A link for downloading this game can be found on the Kickstarter campaign page for Character Quest: Heroes (Tavern Edition).

link.value: Character Quest: Heroes The Card Game – Game Pack #1: King's Guard
Character Quest: Heroes The Card Game – Game Pack #2: Savage Beasts

item.description:
King's Valley Labyrinth is a new extension game of original King's Valley.

Board size is enlarged to 7x7 square grid and 4 pillar stone spaces are added.

As in the original game the simplicity of the game stems from the fact that the movement of all the pieces is the same. 
All pieces move horizontally or vertically or diagonally. 
But when a piece is moved it must continue its movement until, and only until, it reaches a vacant square adjacent to (alongside) either the edge of the board or another piece or pillar stone. 
The game is decided when one player moves the King piece to the center square--the King's Valley--thus winning the game.

Zuqi is a game of intense strategy in which players try to achieve the classic goal of getting four pieces in a row or occupy all four corners at once, but there's a twist. Each piece in your arsenal has unique movement abilities, capture abilities, and other powers at their disposal, and you may only bring 5 out of 8 of them to every game, so each game will play out very differently.

With unique rules that keep the game balanced and fair from beginning to end, every game is intense, and even if you're winning in one moment, the tide can quickly turn. Compete with your opponent for supremacy on the battlefield in a mental tug of war. You take one piece from him, he places another. He takes one from you, you place another. Eventually something has to give, and it shall. This is a game of strategy and skill and only the strong shall prevail.

From the publisher's website:

Create the heroes, adventures and battles of your imagination.

The Open Combat tabletop miniature wargame skirmish rules are suitable for any pre-gunpowder historical period or fantasy setting.

Use any miniatures & terrain you have
Only a small area required (24"x24")
Suitable for pre-gunpowder historical periods and fantasy settings
Customize the characteristics of your fighters, ‘stat’ them any way you like.
Fast setup and play time (30-40mins)
Open Combat puts you in command of a warband of fighters led by their charismatic (or frightening) leader as they match themselves against their foes.

Who the combatants are and what they are fighting about is down to you, your miniature collection and what you have the 'itch' to play.

The 100 page full colour hardback book includes rules for building and customising your warbands along with a range of weapons, skills & abilities (including Influence abilities where your warriors can make psychological attacks against the enemy).

You'll find rules for movement, combat, terrain and additional rules for hiding, climbing and jumping.

Scenarios include 'Open Combat' with three optional deployments including 'confrontation' where your warbands could begin the game intermingled even before the fighting starts! Additional scenarios set the warbands the task of capturing prey or discovering prizes hidden on the battlefield.

Two roster sheet approaches are included: A 'single page' for players that like all of the information in one place; A sheet of character cards for players that like to have separate information for each model.

Also included are guides to creating your first profile, terrain set-ups Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) and a Quick Reference Sheet.

London 1880 — the industrial revolution has brutally changed the face of the world. Resources, industries, transportation, and new empires are being raised from the smoke of coal and fumes of machines. You have come to enter the prestigious million club, a very closed circle of barons of finance and industry.
Investments, opportunities, intrigue — it's all up to you what you'll make in this new world...

Million Club is all about confrontation, with only a single winner standing tall in the end.

item.description:
Seven daring adventurers have trespassed in a dragon's lair, initially seeking its treasure but now just trying to make it out alive as the dragon has woken and is chasing them through its labyrinth. The sooner that a dragon captures an adventurer, the fewer points it's worth at the end of the round — and should an adventurer actually manage to escape, many points in treasure await.

In Drachenhort, players don't represent these adventurers themselves, but rather secretly back a trio of these adventurers. Each turn, the active player rolls a die and moves one of the adventurers further away from the dragon. After all of the adventurers have moved once, all of them are available for movement once again. Don't be too obvious about which adventurers you support, though, for others will drop traps in their path or otherwise hobble them to ensure that they become dragon food first.

At the end of a round, players score points based on how far their adventurers traveled, and after two rounds the player with the most points wins.

item.description:
It's not easy keeping a family close, especially when everyone can shift between their DEAD and ALIVE states at will.

In this quirky take on the fundamentals of game theory, players need to agree to meet in the land of the dead or the land of the living. If they cannot, they lose. If they can, they win. The twist is - if 1 family member is able to betray the rest, they win big, and the others lose big.

Collaborate, debate, investigate... be the one who discards all their cards first by cheating your way between the land of the dead and the land of the living.

This 2-3 player version of Loopin' Louie is re-themed with the Star Wars license. Chewbacca in the Millennium Falcon is tasked with knocking out the other players' stormtroopers. When only one player has stormtroopers left, that player wins.

item.description: Booze Barons is a quick, team-based hidden identity and deduction game set during U.S. Prohibition where you are bootlegging a particular type of booze and secretly delivering it to speakeasies all over the city. Each time you make a delivery, you get a coin, but also reveal information about the type of booze you are bootlegging. Expose bootleggers of opposing mobs and help those who are in your mob since the mob with the most coins at the end wins!

item.description:
The only real gestures game.

"Hints" is a game in which you can not be speak. You must make word or words combination clear to the rest of your team without speaking it. The categories 'saying', 'film', 'TV', 'songs', 'books' and 'radio' have fixed gestures. Your teammates have 60 seconds to guess what you gestures mean.

In many ways 7 Wonders Duel resembles its parent game 7 Wonders as over three ages players acquire cards that provide resources or advance their military or scientific development in order to develop a civilization and complete wonders.

What's different about 7 Wonders Duel is that, as the title suggests, the game is solely for two players, with the players not drafting cards simultaneously from hands of cards, but from a display of face-down and face-up cards arranged at the start of a round. A player can take a card only if it's not covered by any others, so timing comes into play as well as bonus moves that allow you to take a second card immediately. As in the original game, each card that you acquire can be built, discarded for coins, or used to construct a wonder.

Each player starts with four wonder cards, and the construction of a wonder provides its owner with a special ability. Only seven wonders can be built, though, so one player will end up short.

Players can purchase resources at any time from the bank, or they can gain cards during the game that provide them with resources for future building; as you acquire resources, the cost for those particular resources increases for your opponent, representing your dominance in this area.

A player can win 7 Wonders Duel in one of three ways: each time you acquire a military card, you advance the military marker toward your opponent's capital, giving you a bonus at certain positions; if you reach the opponent's capital, you win the game immediately; similarly, if you acquire any six of seven different scientific symbols, you achieve scientific dominance and win immediately; if none of these situations occurs, then the player with the most points at the end of the game wins.

item.description:
Mythic Heroes is a light strategy game, where each player controls a famed hero of Greek Mythology. Players are vying for the title of Greatest of the ancient heroes. Win by finding and defeating mythical creatures or by battling your fellow heroes.

Each player uses the cards in their hand to perform actions on their turn to gain an advantage or trip up the competition. All the while, the Gods of Mt. Olympus will appear at random to mix up the game play.

Can you recite "Twinkle, Twinkle Little Star" backward? Can you name all twelve signs of the zodiac while hammered out of your mind? Can you do a curtsy while balancing a ball on your fist? Influenced by the tests issued to those who may have had tee many martoonies, Sobriety Test is a hilarious and raucous game that will have friends reeling just to prove they're totally "with it." This game will challenge memory, speech, and composure, and that's with or without drinking!

Music Rocks is a game of Music. Divide into teams or play one on one and beat each other in finding hit songs. It’s free for songbirds to sing the songs and for musicians to add optional instruments.

The symbols on the dice represent the most popular words in hit songs from 1890 to date. Roll the dice and try to think of a song lyric with the help of the symbols.
 Example: The symbol of the Sun may make you think of Soundgarden's "Black Hole Sun". Or why not "Summertime, and the living is easy"? But remember, you must always be able to explain it afterwards.

The game has one basic game play and many suggested alternative rules.

Pony Express is a game for the younger audience. Task is to deliver mail on specified places as soon as possible. Points are collected in two ways. The first way by reaching finish line (first gets 12 points, second 10, third 8 ...). Another way is to deliver as many mails. Each mail brings 1 point. The winner is the player who ends up with the most points.

name.value: Grajmy w języki ze Smokiem Memo

item.description:
Game for children aged 3-8 years, learning foreign language (English, German or Spanish).

The educational aim of the game is to develop the sense of hearing (less used at school than the sense of sight) and to memorise the correct pronunciation of the foreign vocabulary.
Square cards have got pictures on one side and QR codes at the back. You set up them like in classic memory, hiding pictures. Using a special application for mobile devices (Android or iOS), produced by publisher, you scan QR codes of two cards of your choice. You will hear two recordings. If they are the same, you’ve just found the pair. Take these cards and look at the pictures to check if you understand the meaning of the foreign words. If recordings are different, it’s not a pair so it’s a next player turn.

The game is now available only in the print-and-play version (in the teacher’s pack "Memo The Dragon", www.memothedragon.pl). Mobile apps are available for free.

Wild Cards are a collection of rules for games that utilize a deck of 52 playing cards. Each card contains the rules for a unique game made up by Nick Pace. I have played these a few times at parties and with family after being challenged to make up some good social games. Think of these as a replacement for the useless joker cards that accompany every box of playing cards.

The artwork is all done by my friend JP, which is based upon a concept sketch I give him. He does a great job with the cartoon graphics since these games are meant for people of ages 8+. Great for family outings, waits at the airport, and parties.

A shipment of rare gold bullion coins are being transported to your bank for safe overnight keeping.

As employees of the bank, you and your 'team' have special access to the outside of the vault where the coins are being stored. Each of your team has knowledge of a small part of the combination.

But plans have changed and betrayal is immenent, your 'friends' aren't so quick to give up their information. And an alarm has been tripped, and you all have 5 minutes to get the coins and get out...

In Bank Vault you have 5 minutes to figure out the code to the vault. The first person to determine the full code is the winner. The code is a series of four digits, each of a different color.

Each person at the table knows one of the numbers, and may be willing to share information via quid pro quo. Although you must realize that:


 one player must lie when asked any specific questions regarding numbers
 one player must lie when asked any specific questions regarding colors
 and everyone else is telling the truth

Doug, Doug, Goose, Caboose is a quick party game inspired by the children's playground game "Duck, Duck, Goose". The game supports 3-8 players, and plays in about 10 minutes.

The dealer shuffles the deck of cards (one per player in the game), and deals one, in turn, to each player, calling out the card each time. Once both the "Goose" and "Caboose" cards are in play, these player race to call out the other players names, going clockwise around the table. The winner scores a point. The cards are shuffled and the game continues until someone scores three points.

But wait! There's more! The "Goose" and "Caboose" players can get tripped up and have to start over if they don't say the names right, or if they don't call the other racing player "Doug". Everyone else is in charge with keeping the racing players honest.

Materials
8x8 checkerboard
64 Othello disks

Play
Board starts out empty.
One player plays black the other white.
Decide who goes first in any convenient manner, turns then alternate.

On a turn, you must,

1) Place a friendly color disk in an empty space that is not orthogonally adjacent to an opponent's color disk (diagonally adjacent is fine) and

2) Move another friendly color disk already on the board any distance in a straight line orthogonally or diagonally, without jumping over other disks and ending the move in an empty space. The last disk moved must not be orthogonally adjacent to an opponent's color disks (diagonally adjacent is fine) or

3) Pass

The game ends when players pass consecutively.

Object
The player with the largest connected group of orthogonally adjacent disks, in his color, wins.

item.description:
Captain’s Quarters is a tile rummy game that replaces colored numbers with the maritime signal flag alphabet. The name Captain’s Quarters is a reference to the nautical theme but also a pun. Each of the 26 flags in the alphabet are divided into quarters creating 104 graphic tiles. Like other tile rummy games, the tiles are used to make groups that can be rearranged to create new groups; however, you will find out quickly the quartered flags add a revolutionary type of gameplay.

The goal is to be the first player to play all of his or her tiles after assembling at least two nautical signal flags correctly.

Captain’s Quarters is a fresh new addition to the world of rummy and mahjong both thematically and mechanically.

item.description:
Europa is a Reversi variant.

Materials
8x8 checkerboard
64 Othello disks

Play
Board starts out empty.

One player plays black the other white.

Decide who goes first in any convenient manner, turns then alternate.

The game is played in two phases.

In the first phase on a turn, you must,

1) Place a friendly color disk in an empty space that is not orthogonally adjacent to an opponent's color disk (diagonally adjacent is fine) or

2) Pass.

The game enters the second phase after players pass consecutively.

So from now on, on a turn, either,

1) Place a disk of your color on an empty space or

2) Place a disk on an empty space so that it and another like color disk already on the board enclose a line of one or more
disks of your opponent. Then flip the disks to your color. A line of enclosed disks may run horizontally, vertically or diagonally.

The game ends when the board is full.

Object
The player with the most disks in his color on the board wins.

item.description:
From the back of the box:
Children learn about the connections between objects and develop language and logic skills. This game is played with jumbo-sized, self-correcting cards. What goes with the chair? That's easy - it's the table! If you're not sure, just see if the two puzzle pieces fit together. Rules for 4 different games are included.

name.value: Hawken: Real-Time Card Game – Sharpshooter vs. Bruiser

item.description: Based on the HAWKEN Online Video Game. Hawken fans and giant Mech fans alike will love the dynamic play experience. Real-time, but pausable gameplay makes the action fast, furious? and fair! Play cards quickly and when ready, grab the FIRE button! Both players pause and resolve the cards in play. Last mech standing wins. Includes decks for Sharpshooter and Bruiser Mechs. Compatible with other Hawken Real-Time Card Game sets. A real-time card game for 2 players, ages 15+, with easy to learn rules, and a 30 minute playing time.

link.value: Hawken: Real-Time Card Game – Scout vs. Grenadier

item.description:
Quotes & Verses (Q&V) is fun! It can liven up your connect groups, prayer meetings and even social gatherings.

Let Q&V be the instrument to deepen friendships, old and new. Share your life experiences with Q&V and be able inspire, give hope, or just simply vent your burdens.

With Q&V, you’ll be surprised at what others could say about your situation. Everyone’s perspective counts.

Q&V is a game about life, a tool for reaching out and touching others. It plays 2-7 players and about 10 minutes per player.

There are 3 types of cards in Q&V. Ideas, Quotes and Verses. During setup each player takes 3 Quotes and 4 verses.

The leader for the round will draw an Idea card and reflect on it. The rest of the group will then take turns using their Quotes and Verses cards to make a reaction to the Leader's sharing.

The Leader gives a point to the reaction they liked the most. The player next in line to the Leader starts the next round as the new leader. Play continues until everyone has taken their turn as leader. The one who has the most points win!

In the year 1938 the Third Reich undertook an expedition to Antarctica. The explored territory was called Neuschwabenland (New Swabia) named after the expedition vessel, Schwabenland.
Unnoticed from the rest of the world a secret base was built: The Base 211 and the Reich began to developed progressive weapon systems.
One day, troops on reconnaissance missions disappeared and there were sightings of strange 2m tall worm-like beasts and house-high creatures. 
Due to the potential threat, the high command of Neuschwabenland caused a general mobilization to deal with the menace and to gather more informations about the strange creatures...

Neuschwabenland is a tactical hex and counter combat game for 2 players simulating the hypothetical struggle between forces of the Third Reich and the forces of Alien life forms, in an Arctic setting. The game is also highly suitable for solitaire play.

The Reich has advanced equipment and special units at disposal, such as the UFO-like flying machine Haunebu.
However, due to the harsh weather conditions they are limited when it comes to unit activation.

Aliens on the other side fight their enemies by sheer force of numbers and can activate all units.
While they lack the firepower of the Reich (with one exception, the Tripod: A monstrous killing machine), they are very dangerous in close combat.

The combat system is inspired by the game Space Crusade.

The game comes with a map (ca. 10 x 18 inch) depicting a part of the Antarctic region, Neuschwabenland, a sheet with 88 (5/8 inch) counters and 6 scenarios.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

item.description: A simple roll and move game. Players must race (using a die) to Home (Square 67). There are 10 squares with special instructions that must be obeyed should your car land on one. First to Home, wins.

Game covers the Battle of Dogger Bank. It was a naval battle fought in the North Sea on 24 January 1915, during the First World War, between squadrons of the British Grand Fleet and the German High Seas Fleet.

Papilio is a card game that recreates the life of butterflies in a fun and didactic way. It combines the fun of an enjoyable game with the discovery of the world of butterflies and some of the most common species in the Mediterranean area.

The aim of the game, fun apart, is to build the richest habitat, and this is achieved by gaining the maximum number of points: completing butterflies, attracting them with plants, trying to make them breed, or catching them (with final penalisation). You also have to ensure that neither predators nor changes in the weather nor human intervention have a negative influence in the strategy of each player.

The game is designed for 2-5 players of all ages, and especially from 6 years old to an adult public. We have devised three levels of difficulty so that the learning process is gradual until dominating all the aspects of the game.

The game has a total of 66 cards, and 40 of them represent butterflies, 17 are actions by the players and 9 refer to the weather. The butterflies chosen represent more or less the variety of diurnal species in the area and the majority are grouped by colours, an approximation to the different families.

Papilio is a game of simulation yet it is also competitive. This means that the dynamic of the game is agile and with continuous toing and froing, and at the end establishes a score in points that in some way is related to the concept of biodiversity and the biological cycles of these insects.

Thus there are more points for the butterflies that are free than those caught with butterfly nets. The diversity of the butterflies is also rewarded and the number of species of the same group. Finally, points are scored for the combination of plants and reproduction cards (caterpillars). Moreover, given the vulnerability of these insects, the game includes three species of protected butterflies, rare or in danger of extinction, species that in the game cannot be caught with butterfly nets.

In the Urban Dictionary Game, players mix words, definitions, pictures and names to form irreverent combinations! They can also draw or act out words and definitions to win over the judge and rule the round.
